cornFarmingDetails.content: Vegetative and reproductive stages are determined on a whole-field basis when at least 50 percent of the plants have reached or are beyond a particular stage.

• VE: emergence of the shoot from the soil.
 • V1: lowest leaf has a visible collar; this leaf has a rounded tip, unlike subsequent pointed leaves.
 • V2: two lowest leaves have a visible collar.
 • V(n): “n” leaf collars present; there are 17 to 22 V stages before tassel emergence.
 • VT: lowest branch of the tassel is visible, but silks have  not emerged.
